body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Photos & Multimedia     N? Leo Manu - Heavenly Voices - Video Archive - 2016               N? Leo Manu - Heavenly Voices - Video Archive - 2016       N? Leo Manu is part of ?Ike Hana No?eau, a series of Hawaiian cultural programs sponsored by Hawai?i Volcanoes National Park and the Hawai?i Pacific Parks Association.         June 15, 2016 - H?lau N? Pua O Uluhaim?lama Hailing from the island of Hawai?i, H?lau N? Pua O Uluhaim?lama is dedicated to perpetuating the culture and the arts of the hula. They are lead by kumu hula Emery Aceret, a student of the revered kumu hula Ray Fonseca and have participated in many notable hula competitions through the years including the Merrie Monarch Festival.         May 18, 2016 -  Richard Likeke Teanio Richard was born and raised in K?ne'ohe, O'ahu. He was inspired by his father to play the 'ukulele and slack-key by watching and learning. Since 1990, he's been featured on multiple recording projects for Kekuhi Kanahele, Diana Aki, Russell Mauga and Walter Aipolani.           April 20, 2016 - Haunani's Aloha Expressions Enjoy an evening of Hawaiian music and hula with Haunani's Aloha Expressions.         March 16, 2016 - Kai Ho‘opi‘i Listen to the leo nahenahe of Kai Ho'opi'i sharing the music of his 'ohana from Kahakuloa, Maui             February 17, 2016 - H?lau Ke ?Olu Makani o Maunaloa H?lau Ke ?Olu Makani o Maunaloa began in 1990 and has been perpetuating the art of hula for more than twenty years. The h?lau, under the direction of Kumu Hula Meleana Manuel, is from the Kilauea-Volcano area on the Big Island of Hawai’i.     Return to Photos & Multimedia
title: Hawai'i Volcanoes National Park: N? Leo Manu - Heavenly Voices - Video Archive - 2016
